identificationModule.briefTitle: Remote Device Interrogation In The Emergency Department
identificationModule.officialTitle: Remote Device Interrogation In The Emergency Department

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
A prospective, post market, non-randomized study to evaluate the reduction in time to interrogation for patients with St. Jude Medical remote care compatible devices interrogated by the unpaired Merlin@home transmitter in the Emergency Department (ED). Two sites will enroll up to 100 patients total.

Expected duration of the study is 6 months. Once enrolled the patient will participate in the study for the duration of the Emergency Department stay, until discharged or admitted to the hospital.

armGroups.label: Interrogation with unpaired remote transmitter
armGroups.description: Interrogation with an unpaired remote monitoring transmitter for devices that are compatible.

armGroups.label: Interrogation with programmer
armGroups.description: Interrogation with programmer according to usual standard of care

interventions.name: Unpaired remote monitoring transmitter
otherNames: St. Jude Medical Merlin@home remote monitoring transmitter

primaryOutcomes.description: Time to interrogation is defined as the time from Triage (decision to interrogate the device) until the first of: Completion of interrogation, Time of Clinical/Treatment decision, or Emergency Department check out time.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: On day of Emergency Department admission

secondaryOutcomes.description: Defined as the time from the Emergency Department Check In Time until the first of: Time of Clinical/Treatment Decision or Emergency Department Check Out Time (discharged/leaves Emergency Department or admitted to hospital).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: On day of Emergency Department admission

otherOutcomes.description: Defined as the time from the Emergency Department Check In Time until the Emergency Department Check Out Time (discharged/leaves Emergency Department or admitted to hospital).
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: On day of Emergency Department admission

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Present to Emergency Department with an implanted pacemaker or defibrillator.
2. Are 18 years of age or older, or of legal age to give informed consent specific to state law.
3. Are willing and able to provide informed consent for study participation.

Exclusion Criteria:

* None

overallOfficials.name: Marc Girsky, MD
overallOfficials.affiliation: Los Angeles Biomedical Research Institute at Harbor - UCLA

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: There were 16 screen failures because at the time of their enrollment, the patient group had met maximum enrollment for their patient group (compatible vs. non-compatible cardiac device) under the initial protocol.
participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: Subjects enrolled from 20-September-2013 to 14-April-2015 from the Genesis Healthcare Emergency Department located in Zanesville, Ohio.
